trans-unit.source: Using the Salesforce Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Salesforce Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Salesforce Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Salesforce Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the Salesforce Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the Salesforce Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to Salesforce and create and modify entities such as Accounts, Leads, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Connect to Salesforce and create and modify entities such as Accounts, Leads, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Following are the typical integration scenarios that involve Salesforce:
trans-unit.target: Following are the typical integration scenarios that involve Salesforce:

trans-unit.source: Account Synchronization between Salesforce and ERP systems such as SAP and QuickBooks
trans-unit.target: Account Synchronization between Salesforce and ERP systems such as SAP and QuickBooks

trans-unit.source: Order to Cash flow from Salesforce to ERP systems
trans-unit.target: Order to Cash flow from Salesforce to ERP systems

trans-unit.source: As part of Connector package settings, the user can specify entities the connector can manage and the actions, input and output parameters are dynamically populated.
trans-unit.target: As part of Connector package settings, the user can specify entities the connector can manage and the actions, input and output parameters are dynamically populated.

trans-unit.source: Following are the different actions available in Salesforce connector:
trans-unit.target: Following are the different actions available in Salesforce connector:

trans-unit.source: Create Entity - Use this action to create a new Salesforce entity such as Account, Case or a Custom Object
trans-unit.target: Create Entity - Use this action to create a new Salesforce entity such as Account, Case or a Custom Object

trans-unit.source: Update Entity - Use this action to update an existing Salesforce entity
trans-unit.target: Update Entity - Use this action to update an existing Salesforce entity

trans-unit.source: Upsert Entity - Use this action to update an existing Salesforce entity or create one if it does not exist
trans-unit.target: Upsert Entity - Use this action to update an existing Salesforce entity or create one if it does not exist

trans-unit.source: Delete Entity - Use this action to delete an existing Salesforce entity
trans-unit.target: Delete Entity - Use this action to delete an existing Salesforce entity

trans-unit.source: Execute Query - Use this action to execute a SELECT query that is written in Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL)
trans-unit.target: Execute Query - Use this action to execute a SELECT query that is written in Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL)

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can add the Salesforce Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the Salesforce Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Create a SalesForce Connector API App
trans-unit.target: Create a SalesForce Connector API App

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure Marketplace using the + NEW option at the bottom right of the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure Marketplace using the + NEW option at the bottom right of the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Browse to “Web and Mobile > API apps” and search for “SalesForce”.
trans-unit.target: Browse to “Web and Mobile > API apps” and search for “SalesForce”.

trans-unit.source: Configure the SalesForce Connector by providing the details for Hosting Plan, the resource group and selecting the name of the API App:
trans-unit.target: Configure the SalesForce Connector by providing the details for Hosting Plan, the resource group and selecting the name of the API App:

trans-unit.source: Configure the SalesForce Entities you are interested in reading/writing in the 'Package Settings'.
trans-unit.target: Configure the SalesForce Entities you are interested in reading/writing in the 'Package Settings'.

trans-unit.source: With this, you can now create a SalesForce Conenctor API App.
trans-unit.target: With this, you can now create a SalesForce Conenctor API App.

trans-unit.source: Create a Logic App
trans-unit.target: Create a Logic App

trans-unit.source: Let us create a simple logic app that creates an account in Salesforce and updates billing address details of the same account.
trans-unit.target: Let us create a simple logic app that creates an account in Salesforce and updates billing address details of the same account.

trans-unit.source: Login to Azure Portal and click on ‘New -> Web + mobile -> Logic App’:
trans-unit.target: Login to Azure Portal and click on ‘New -> Web + mobile -> Logic App’:

trans-unit.source: In the ‘Create logic app’ page, provide the required details such as name, app service plan and location:
trans-unit.target: In the ‘Create logic app’ page, provide the required details such as name, app service plan and location:

trans-unit.source: Click on ‘Triggers and Actions’.
trans-unit.target: Click on ‘Triggers and Actions’.

trans-unit.source: The Logic App editor opens:
trans-unit.target: The Logic App editor opens:

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Run this logic manually’ which means that this logic app can be invoked only manually:
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Run this logic manually’ which means that this logic app can be invoked only manually:

trans-unit.source: Expand ‘API Apps in this resource group’ in Gallery to see all the available API Apps.
trans-unit.target: Expand ‘API Apps in this resource group’ in Gallery to see all the available API Apps.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Salesforce’ from the gallery and the ‘Salesforce connector’ gets added to the flow:
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Salesforce’ from the gallery and the ‘Salesforce connector’ gets added to the flow:

trans-unit.source: To authorize your Logic App to access your SalesForce account, click on ‘Authorize’ to provide Salesforce login credentials:
trans-unit.target: To authorize your Logic App to access your SalesForce account, click on ‘Authorize’ to provide Salesforce login credentials:

trans-unit.source: You are redirected to Salesforce login page and you can authenticate with your Salesforce credentials:
trans-unit.target: You are redirected to Salesforce login page and you can authenticate with your Salesforce credentials:

trans-unit.source: Once the authorization is complete, all the actions are displayed:
trans-unit.target: Once the authorization is complete, all the actions are displayed:

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Create Account’ action and the input parameters are displayed:
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Create Account’ action and the input parameters are displayed:

trans-unit.source: Provide ‘Account Name’ and click ✓:
trans-unit.target: Provide ‘Account Name’ and click ✓:

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Salesforce Connector’ from the ‘Recently Used’ section in the gallery and a new Salesforce action gets added.
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Salesforce Connector’ from the ‘Recently Used’ section in the gallery and a new Salesforce action gets added.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Update Account’ from the list of actions and the input parameters of ‘Update Account’ action are displayed:
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Update Account’ from the list of actions and the input parameters of ‘Update Account’ action are displayed:

trans-unit.source: Click on ‘+’ next to ‘Record Id’ to pick the id value from the output of ‘Create Account’ action:
trans-unit.target: Click on ‘+’ next to ‘Record Id’ to pick the id value from the output of ‘Create Account’ action:

trans-unit.source: Provide values for Billing Street, Billing City, Billing State and Billing Zip Code and click ✓:
trans-unit.target: Provide values for Billing Street, Billing City, Billing State and Billing Zip Code and click ✓:

trans-unit.source: Click on OK on Logic app editor screen and then click 'Create'.
trans-unit.target: Click on OK on Logic app editor screen and then click 'Create'.

trans-unit.source: It will take approximately 30 seconds for the creation to complete.
trans-unit.target: It will take approximately 30 seconds for the creation to complete.

trans-unit.source: Browse the newly created Logic App and click on 'Run' to initiate a run.
trans-unit.target: Browse the newly created Logic App and click on 'Run' to initiate a run.

trans-unit.source: You can check that a new account by the name 'Contoso' is created in your Salesforce account.
trans-unit.target: You can check that a new account by the name 'Contoso' is created in your Salesforce account.

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
